title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message:
This 820-00850 board shows no discernible liquid damage but has an unknown history. The trackpad clicks, fans spin, but nothing else happens. DFU Restore was successful, with Apple logo and progress bar on target machine and padlock on host machine.

I have PPBUS 12.6V, PP3V3_G3H, PP5V_G3S, all AWAKE rails, and the SSD rails. The big coils have similar resistances to ground as on another board. The CPU area gets warm but there is no chime. 

Anything else to check before I blame this on a bad U0500?

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message:
Machine gets stuck into progress bar?
Can't enter to recovery mode?

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message: There is no chime, no progress bar, no screen backlight, no response to startup keys.

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message: Upon further inspection it looks like this board is cycling: every few seconds I get these rails for several seconds, then back down to 0V: PPVCC_S0_CPU, PPVCCSA_S0_CPU, PPVCCIO_S0_CPU, along with cycling fans.

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message:
"DFU Restore was successful, with [B]Apple logo and progress bar on target machine[/B]"
???

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message: Weirdly, that's correct. Sometimes, the DFU Restore fails, but usually I get video on the target machine (see below) and padlock on the host. Still, the machine reverts to cycling instead of chiming and progressing with the startup.

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message:
Does it stuck in progress bar, or restart before end of it?
Force the machine off and check if starts pressing COMMAND + R.

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message: As I said before, there is no chime, no progress bar, no screen backlight, no response to any startup keys. Just the fans and CPU voltages cycling on and off. I still suspect a short somewhere but haven't found it yet.

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message: Very unlikely to have a short, once you get image after DFU completion.

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message: During the cycling, PPBUS goes from 12.6 to 12.3 V and so forth. Does this implicate the SMC (i.e. T2 chip)?

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message: Do you have a BIN file?

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ulh2l73-Pc3LpqACVlGXqx-RD2H8ErLR/view?usp=share_link[/URL]
Don't forget to make backup first...

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message: No change after a reflash of the SoC ROM. Still shows video during DFU Restore but never makes it to POST.

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message:
Disconnect anything from MLB.
Check if voltages still pulsing.

title: 820-00850-A without startup (A1989 MacBook Pro 2019)
message:
Since the ROM reflashing, the pulsing has changed to a more steady, stagnating state. The CPU rails are at their pre-POST levels and remain there, without the fluctuations usually seen around the chime time (VCore is a steady 0.9 V, for instance). Stays like this for a minute or two, then turns off.

Same behavior when I unplug everything from the board.
